top_categories.workout_context: Ride the Gravel Trails' Minnesota rolling gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Ride the Gravel Trails' Minnesota rolling, Local event forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 60 miles.
At Ride the Gravel Trails, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Ride the Gravel Trails. Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Ride the Gravel Trails' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
60 miles on Minnesota rolling gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Varied gradients on Minnesota rolling gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
When someone attacks on Minnesota rolling gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Ride the Gravel Trails, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Base fitness for Ride the Gravel Trails. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Torque for headwinds and Minnesota rolling gravel. When cadence drops below 70rpm, muscular strength keeps the watts up.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Ride the Gravel Trails’s 60 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Ride the Gravel Trails requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on minnesota rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: minnesota rolling, local event, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 60 miles of minnesota rolling gravel in Dakota County, Minnesota.
